channel.title: orientation on 3D Visualization System for Ophthalmic Surgery
channel.description: Recent content in orientation on 3D Visualization System for Ophthalmic Surgery

item.title: Quick Access Bar
item.description: The Quick Access Bar contains specified buttons for display options. Click the buttons to quickly change settings or, if available, click the drop-down menu below buttons to select a specific option. NOTE: To change the available buttons or the options available for a button, see Settings. Use the Quick Access Bar to change the following display modes and settings: 1 Swap layout – Changes the number of video inputs displayed on the Case screen (1 or 2).

item.title: Footswitch (Optional)
item.description: The footswitch performs basic functions during operation through controls operated by a foot. 1 Left push button – Changes the camera orientation between standard and inverted. 2 Right push button – Starts or stops movie recordings. 3 Left pedal – Cycles to the previous imaging mode. 4 Right pedal – Cycles to the next imaging mode.
